intro: Rhaptostylum mayteniodes, commonly known as the golden sassafras, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain seeds covered in a sticky, resinous coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
